lines.text:
[on phone]
It's Charlie, Angel. Time to go to work.
Nobody sees Charlie except me. He's a very private person.
Come on, be a pal. I can't tell you how many hours I've spent lying in bed trying to put a face... and a body on that voice.
[referring to Charlie]
Beats watching the Late Show, I imagine.
A little biddy nightgown like that, she'll catch her death in the swamp. Just like her daddy did.
Eh, I can assure you, Miss LeMaire, Suite 400 is on the fourth floor.
the fourth floor.
The entire floor?
Yes. There are two of us.
It's a nice room. Isn't it?
It's not bad. A little overdone.
It's not bad actually, kind of early American nothing.
Go shake 'em up, Sabrina.

[about Bosley]
Been at it for a couple of hours now. Doesn't look like he's after birds.

[takes a look at Bosley through binoculars]
Not unless they fly underwater.
I saw a Speckled Robin. Now that's the first one I've seen this far North in years.
By any chance, did you see a Lying Swallow?
I don't believe I know the species.
I'm looking at one.

[aiming a riffle at Beau]
I don't trust a man who's teeth don't show when he smiles.
What'll we do with 'em?
Well, we came to dig a grave, may have to make it a whole cemetery.

[on speakerphone]
Well, that's it until next time, now I'd better get back to the job at hand.
